text: The 2019 European Canoe Slalom Championships took place in Pau, France under the auspices of the European Canoe Association (ECA). It was the 20th edition of the competition and Pau hosted the event for the first time. The events took place at the Pau-Pyrénées Whitewater Stadium from 29 May to 2 June 2019. ==Medal Summary== ===Men=== ====Canoe==== {| |- |C1 | Benjamin Savšek || 98.59 | Martin Thomas || 99.38 | Sideris Tasiadis || 100.77 |- |C1 team | Benjamin Savšek Luka Božič Anže Berčič || 102.25 | Denis Gargaud Chanut Martin Thomas Cédric Joly || 102.41 | Dmitrii Khramtsov Kirill Setkin Pavel Kotov || 104.61 |} ====Kayak==== {| |- |K1 | || 93.67 | || 94.44 | || 94.91 |- |K1 team | Jiří Prskavec Vít Přindiš Vavřinec Hradilek || 95.72 | Peter Kauzer Niko Testen Martin Srabotnik || 99.91 | Hannes Aigner Sebastian Schubert Stefan Hengst || 100.09 |} ===Women=== ====Canoe==== {| |- |C1 | || 109.50 | || 120.15 | || 125.39 |- |C1 team | Mallory Franklin Kimberley Woods Sophie Ogilvie || 127.14 | Elena Apel Andrea Herzog Jasmin Schornberg || 127.43 | Tereza Fišerová Eva Říhová Kateřina Havlíčková || 131.19 |} ====Kayak==== {| |- |K1 | Amálie Hilgertová || 104.95 | Mallory Franklin || 105.14 | Jasmin Schornberg || 107.52 |- |K1 team | Marie-Zélia Lafont Lucie Baudu Camille Prigent || 114.08 | Ricarda Funk Jasmin Schornberg Elena Apel || 115.07 | Corinna Kuhnle Viktoria Wolffhardt Nina Weratschnig || 120.25 |} ==Medals Table== == References == == External links == * European Canoe Association * Official website Category:European Canoe Slalom Championships European Canoe Slalom Championships European Canoe Slalom Championships European Canoe Slalom Championships European Canoe Slalom Championships
